page.title: 13Gomm Valley Butterflies
page.content: Within the 250 acres of the Gomm Valley we have a Site of Special Scientific Interest which covers 10 acres. It is managed by the Berkshire, Buckinghamshire and Oxfordshire Naturalists' Trust on an annual agreement. BBONT belongs to the Royal Society for Nature Conservation which seeks to identify and care for habitats for wildlife.These butterflies have been seen in the Gomm Valley this year:comma,peacock,small tortoiseshell,brimstone,speckled wood,small heath,dingy skipper,holly blue,orange tip,common blue,green veined white,small blue,large and small skipper,marbled white,ringlet, dark green fritillary and small copper. We hope that this important site is preserved so that we can see these butterflies in the future.
